place.name: PINVIN
place.gazetteerText: PINVIN, a chapelry in Pershore, St. Andrew parish, Worcester; ½ a mile N by W of Pershore r. station. Post-town, Pershore. Acres, 1, 116. Real property, £1, 615. Pop., 269. Houses, 53. Seaford Grange is the seat of R. Varden, Esq. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Pershore, in the diocese of Worcester. The church is old. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
